column4: hello, has anyone got soundconverter to convert from mp3 to ogg in dapper?
I think lame can do it, but I can't be sure, let me check.
ok, how do i get/use lame?
sudo apt-get install lame, then use lame as you would cp: "lame inputfile outputfile"
i've installed lame, but it's outputting mp3, how do i make it output ogg?
you've got to specify the output extension; I wanted to change x.mp3 to x.ogg, I did this: "lame x.mp3 x.ogg"
Nope - That's weird, because lame works fine for me. Can you show me what you're putting into the terminal?
then it outputs in terminal: LAME version 3.96.1 (http://lame.sourceforge.net/)
I've found something different - Try "sudo apt-get install nautilus-script-audio-convert"
ok, installed, how do i use it?
no luck finding how to use it?
